required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Compliance, Acceptability, Safety and Tolerance of a Lower Calorie Protein Substitute for the Dietary Management of Phenylketonuria in Children and Adults - a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the compliance, acceptability, gastrointestinal (GI) tolerance and safety of a lower calorie amino acid based liquid protein substitute for patients with Phenylketonuria (PKU) or hyperphenylalaninemia (HPA).

primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire on amounts offered and amounts actually consumed, compared to recommended amount. Amounts (values) are recorded

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at baseline and end of intervetnion (day 31)
secondary_outcome.description: Tick-box questionnaire on overall liking and acceptability of product (ie dislike a lot, dislike moderately, neutral, like moderately, like a lot)

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood phenylalanine and other amino acid levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at baselien and end of intervention (day 31)
recorded at baseline, beginning of intervention and end of intervention(12 out of 31 days in total)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire detailing any GI symptoms, severity (none, mild, moderate, severe) and change from usual.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Recorded at basleine and end of intervention (day 31)
Recorded at baseline and end of intervention (day 31)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurements of height (m) and weight (kg) at baseline and end of study.

arm_group.description: Single arm designed, 3 day baseline, 28 day on the lower calorie amino acid based liquid protein substitute.

intervention.description: The evaluated dietary supplement is a lower calorie amino acid based liquid protein substitute designed for patients with PKU.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female
- 3 years of age or above
- Diagnosed with classical or variant type phenylketonuria (PKU), or hyperphenylalaninemia (HPA)
- Have been compliant in taking at least one amino acid-based, Phe-free protein substitute, providing at least 20g protein equivalent daily, for at least 1 month prior to study commencement
- Have a prescribed daily Phe allowance
- Written informed consent from patient, or from parent / carer if applicable
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or lactating
- Requiring enteral tube or parenteral nutrition
- Major hepatic or renal dysfunction
- Participation in other studies within 1 month prior to entry to this study
- Allergy to any of the study product ingredients
- Investigator concern around the patient being underweight (e.g.: BMI lower than 18.5kg/m2 for adults) and/or having an eating disorder
- Investigator concern around willingness/ability of patient or parent/carer to comply with protocol requirements
